message_1: What is the total number of functions from a 3-element set to a 4-element set in second-order logic?
message_2:
In second-order logic, the total number of functions from a 3-element set to a 4-element set can be calculated using the formula:

number of functions = (size of the codomain)^(size of the domain)

In this case, the domain has 3 elements and the codomain has 4 elements. So, the total number of functions can be calculated as:

number of functions = 4^3 = 64

There are 64 possible functions from a 3-element set to a 4-element set in second-order logic.
